title: The Consensus Awakening
outcome: Three days after the latest system crisis, a citywide broadcast delivers the message “Truth is consensus. Consensus is broken.” The population splinters as assemblies form in each district to forge new social compacts, fracturing the city’s unity but sparking a search for true self-government.

events.description: A synchronized broadcast interrupts all devices with the phrase 'Truth is consensus. Consensus is broken.' Confusion spreads as no one claims responsibility.
Neighborhood forums form, each debating what 'consensus' should mean for their local rules. Arguments turn fierce as old alliances and resentments re-emerge.

The Council attempts to convene a citywide assembly but attendance is sparse; most districts insist on governing themselves. BCI compliance scores become nearly irrelevant as people set their own norms.
Districts publish their autonomous charters, some abolishing scores, others inventing local reputations. Trust networks replace city government in most daily matters.
Amid the fragmentation, evidence surfaces that Halden triggered these reforms intentionally—his death was meant to unlock the city’s collective will.
